results.title: I'm going home = Je rentre a la maison [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Artificial Eye, France 2 Cinema, Gemini Films, Madragoa Filmes, Paolo Branco and Manuel de Oliveira
results.brief_description: In this elegiac feature from Portuguese director Manoel de Oliveira, Michel Piccoli plays Gilbert Valence, a well-respected, and aging, theatre and screen actor. Valence is aggrieved by the sudden death of close family, retreating somewhat, but also drawing enormous pleasure from the responsibility of caring for his grandson. Internalising his grief, Valence comes to terms with the fact that society is changing whilst he remains the same - his agent offers him parts in lucrative but lowbrow dramas, despite Valence’s protestation that he values his craft; similarly Valence is outraged by the suggestion that he may find solace in romance with a young actress. Piccoli puts in a grand performance as Valence, and de Oliveira captures the savouring of everyday pleasures - a fine new pair of shoes or a daily coffee at his favourite cafe. These observations set a gently comic, if slightly melancholic tone, providing a deft and moving rumination on the themes of aging and artistry. Support cast include Catherine Deneuve, as a fellow thespian and John Malkovich, as an American director. This film represented a breakthrough for de Oliveira, who started his career as a silent era - reflected in the use of expression and gesture to convey meaning, rather than dialogue laden exchanges.
results.title_for_label: I’m going home = Je rentre a la maison [DVD]
results.creator_credit_for_label: Artificial Eye, France 2 Cinema, Gemini Films, Madragoa Filmes, Paolo Branco and Manuel de Oliveira

results.title: I'm feeling happy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Children sing about and experience a number of things that bring happiness: The pleasures of smelling and eating good things, a bubbly bath, waking up on a sunny morning; the accomplishment of learning to drive, the inner satisfaction of being helpful without thought of reward and the warmth of sharing a friendship.

results.title: I'm a little teapot
results.brief_description: 35 delightful and well known activity songs and rhymes presented by Elizabeth Watts which will entertain and delight young children. Apart from the title song, “I’m a little teapot”, classic songs such as “Humpty Dumpty”, “Baa baa black sheep” and “The Hokey cokey” are featured.

results.title: I'm a fool
results.creator_credit: Perspective Films, Dan McCann and Noel Black
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
This adaptation of Sherwood Anderson’s short story tells of a few milestones in the life of an adolescent boy who, at the turn of the century, left home and attempted to make a life of his own. Stars Ron Howard.

results.title: I'll tell you where to put your airport

results.title: I'll play my guitar softly
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Kindergarten children are observed here responding to the rhythm of music. The teacher, while playing a guitar, encourages different responses at different times, sometimes the rhythmic cadence of sticks and sometimes a vocal response. At the conclusion the children disperse in an orderly way for refreshment and “quiet time”.

results.title: I'll go again
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Michael McKennirey and Paul Cowan
results.brief_description: I’ll Go Again is a film about four athletes and a team that competed in the 1976 Montreal Olympics. They had trained courageously to be among those who would mount the podium to receive a medal. None did. Was it worth it? The film answers the question. (Awards: Budapest; Yorkton)
